  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.ExtendedDeserializer
    This class has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use Deserializer instead.
    org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.ExtendedSerializer
    This class has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use Serializer instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.PartitionGrouper
    since 2.4 release; will be removed in 3.0.0 via KAFKA-7785
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.PrincipalBuilder
    As of Kafka 1.0.0, use KafkaPrincipalBuilder instead. This will be removed in a future major release.
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.apache.kafka.streams.test.ConsumerRecordFactory
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestInputTopic instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.DefaultPartitionGrouper
    since 2.4 release; will be removed in 3.0.0 via KAFKA-7785
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.DefaultPrincipalBuilder
    As of Kafka 1.0.0. This will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.ElectPreferredLeadersOptions
    Since 2.4.0. Use Admin.electLeaders(ElectionType, Set, ElectLeadersOptions).
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.ElectPreferredLeadersResult
    Since 2.4.0. Use Admin.electLeaders(ElectionType, Set, ElectLeadersOptions).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.test.OutputVerifier
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestOutputTopic and standard assertion libraries instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Serialized
    since 2.1. Use Grouped instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.UsePreviousTimeOnInvalidTimestamp
    since 2.5. Use UsePartitionTimeOnInvalidTimestamp instead

    Exceptions and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.errors.NotLeaderForPartitionException
    since 2.6. Use NotLeaderOrFollowerException.

    Field and Description
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SslConfigs.DEFAULT_PRINCIPAL_BUILDER_CLASS
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release. In recent versions, the config is optional and there is no default.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_ENABLED_MECHANISMS
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.common.config.SaslConfigs.SASL_KERBEROS_PRINCIPAL_TO_LOCAL_RULES_DOC
    As of 1.0.0. This field will be removed in a future major release.

  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsBuilder.addGlobalStore(StoreBuilder<?>, String, String, Consumed<K, V>, String, ProcessorSupplier<K, V>)
    use StreamsBuilder.addGlobalStore(StoreBuilder, String, Consumed, ProcessorSupplier) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsMetrics.addLatencyAndThroughputSensor(String, String, String, Sensor.RecordingLevel, String...)
    since 2.5. Use addLatencyRateTotalSensor() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsMetrics.addThroughputSensor(String, String, String, Sensor.RecordingLevel, String...)
    since 2.5. Use addRateTotalSensor() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.TimeWindows.advanceBy(long)
    Use TimeWindows.advanceBy(Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver.advanceWallClockTime(long)
    Since 2.4 use TopologyTestDriver.advanceWallClockTime(Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.JoinWindows.after(long)
    Use JoinWindows.after(Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.Admin.alterConfigs(Map<ConfigResource, Config>)
    Since 2.3. Use Admin.incrementalAlterConfigs(Map).
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.KafkaAdminClient.alterConfigs(Map<ConfigResource, Config>, AlterConfigsOptions)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.Admin.alterConfigs(Map<ConfigResource, Config>, AlterConfigsOptions)
    Since 2.3. Use Admin.incrementalAlterConfigs(Map, AlterConfigsOptions).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.JoinWindows.before(long)
    Use JoinWindows.before(Duration) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.RecordMetadata.checksum()
    As of Kafka 0.11.0. Because of the potential for message format conversion on the broker, the computed checksum may not match what was stored on the broker, or what will be returned to the consumer. It is therefore unsafe to depend on this checksum for end-to-end delivery guarantees. Additionally, message format v2 does not include a record-level checksum (for performance, the record checksum was replaced with a batch checksum). To maintain compatibility, a partial checksum computed from the record timestamp, serialized key size, and serialized value size is returned instead, but this should not be depended on for end-to-end reliability.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord.checksum()
    As of Kafka 0.11.0. Because of the potential for message format conversion on the broker, the checksum returned by the broker may not match what was computed by the producer. It is therefore unsafe to depend on this checksum for end-to-end delivery guarantees. Additionally, message format v2 does not include a record-level checksum (for performance, the record checksum was replaced with a batch checksum). To maintain compatibility, a partial checksum computed from the record timestamp, serialized key size, and serialized value size is returned instead, but this should not be depended on for end-to-end reliability.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.producer.Producer.close(long, TimeUnit)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.Admin.close(long, TimeUnit)
    Since 2.2. Use Admin.close(Duration) or Admin.close().
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.MockConsumer.close(long, TimeUnit)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.Consumer.close(long, TimeUnit)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.close(long, TimeUnit)
    Since 2.0. Use KafkaConsumer.close(Duration) or KafkaConsumer.close().
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.close(long, TimeUnit)
    Use KafkaStreams.close(Duration) instead; note, that KafkaStreams.close(Duration) has different semantics and does not block on zero, e.g., `Duration.ofMillis(0)`.
    org.apache.kafka.connect.source.SourceTask.commitRecord(SourceRecord)
    Use SourceTask.commitRecord(SourceRecord, RecordMetadata) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.MockConsumer.committed(TopicPartition)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.Consumer.committed(TopicPartition)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.committed(TopicPartition)
    since 2.4 Use KafkaConsumer.committed(Set) instead
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.MockConsumer.committed(TopicPartition, Duration)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.Consumer.committed(TopicPartition, Duration)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.committed(TopicPartition, Duration)
    since 2.4 Use KafkaConsumer.committed(Set, Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.Admin.electPreferredLeaders(Collection<TopicPartition>)
    Since 2.4.0. Use Admin.electLeaders(ElectionType, Set).
    org.apache.kafka.clients.admin.Admin.electPreferredLeaders(Collection<TopicPartition>, ElectPreferredLeadersOptions)
    Since 2.4.0. Use Admin.electLeaders(ElectionType, Set, ElectLeadersOptions).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetch(K, K, long, long)
    Use ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetch(Object, Object, Instant, Instant) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetch(K, long, long)
    Use ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetch(Object, Instant, Instant) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetchAll(long, long)
    Use ReadOnlyWindowStore.fetchAll(Instant, Instant) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.ProcessorContext.forward(K, V, int)
    please use ProcessorContext.forward(Object, Object, To) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.MockProcessorContext.forward(K, V, int)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.ProcessorContext.forward(K, V, String)
    please use ProcessorContext.forward(Object, Object, To) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.MockProcessorContext.forward(K, V, String)
    org.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.KafkaPrincipal.fromString(String)
    As of 1.0.0. This method will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaClientSupplier.getAdminClient(Map<String, Object>)
    Not called by Kafka Streams, which now uses KafkaClientSupplier.getAdmin(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsConfig.getConsumerConfigs(String, String)
    use StreamsConfig.getMainConsumerConfigs(String, String, int)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KTable.groupBy(KeyValueMapper<? super K, ? super V, KeyValue<KR, VR>>, Serialized<KR, VR>)
    since 2.1. Use KTable.groupBy(KeyValueMapper, Grouped) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.groupBy(KeyValueMapper<? super K, ? super V, KR>, Serialized<KR, V>)
    since 2.1. Use KStream.groupBy(KeyValueMapper, Grouped) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.groupByKey(Serialized<K, V>)
    since 2.1. Use KStream.groupByKey(Grouped) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.join(KStream<K, VO>, ValueJoiner<? super V, ? super VO, ? extends VR>, JoinWindows, Joined<K, V, VO>)
    since 2.4. Use KStream.join(KStream, ValueJoiner, JoinWindows, StreamJoined) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.leftJoin(KStream<K, VO>, ValueJoiner<? super V, ? super VO, ? extends VR>, JoinWindows, Joined<K, V, VO>)
    since 2.4. Use KStream.leftJoin(KStream, ValueJoiner, JoinWindows, StreamJoined) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.JoinWindows.maintainMs()
    since 2.1. This function should not be used anymore, since JoinWindows.until(long) is deprecated in favor of JoinWindows.grace(Duration).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Windows.maintainMs()
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.TimeWindows.maintainMs()
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.UnlimitedWindows.maintainMs()
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.SessionWindows.maintainMs()
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.metadataForKey(String, K, Serializer<K>)
    Since 2.5. Use KafkaStreams.queryMetadataForKey(String, Object, Serializer) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.metadataForKey(String, K, StreamPartitioner<? super K, ?>)
    Since 2.5. Use KafkaStreams.queryMetadataForKey(String, Object, StreamPartitioner) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Joined.name()
    this method will be removed in a in a future release
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Joined.named(String)
    use Joined.as(String) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.JoinWindows.of(long)
    Use JoinWindows.of(Duration) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.TimeWindows.of(long)
    Use TimeWindows.of(Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.connect.sink.SinkTask.onPartitionsAssigned(Collection<TopicPartition>)
    Use SinkTask.open(Collection) for partition initialization.
    org.apache.kafka.connect.sink.SinkTask.onPartitionsRevoked(Collection<TopicPartition>)
    Use SinkTask.close(Collection) instead for partition cleanup.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.outerJoin(KStream<K, VO>, ValueJoiner<? super V, ? super VO, ? extends VR>, JoinWindows, Joined<K, V, VO>)
    since 2.4. Use KStream.outerJoin(KStream, ValueJoiner, JoinWindows, StreamJoined) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.NoOffsetForPartitionException.partition()
    please use NoOffsetForPartitionException.partitions
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.Stores.persistentSessionStore(String, long)
    since 2.1 Use Stores.persistentSessionStore(String, Duration) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.Stores.persistentWindowStore(String, long, int, long, boolean)
    since 2.1 Use Stores.persistentWindowStore(String, Duration, Duration, boolean) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver.pipeInput(ConsumerRecord<byte[], byte[]>)
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestInputTopic instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver.pipeInput(List<ConsumerRecord<byte[], byte[]>>)
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestInputTopic instead
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.MockConsumer.poll(long)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.Consumer.poll(long)
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.poll(long)
    Since 2.0. Use KafkaConsumer.poll(Duration), which does not block beyond the timeout awaiting partition assignment. See KIP-266 for more information.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.WindowStore.put(K, V)
    as timestamp is not provided for the key-value pair, this causes inconsistency to identify the window frame to which the key belongs. Use WindowStore.put(Object, Object, long) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver.readOutput(String)
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestOutputTopic instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver.readOutput(String, Deserializer<K>, Deserializer<V>)
    Since 2.4 use methods of TestOutputTopic instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsMetrics.recordLatency(Sensor, long, long)
    since 2.5. Use Sensor#record() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.StreamsMetrics.recordThroughput(Sensor, long)
    since 2.5. Use Sensor#record() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.ProcessorContext.schedule(long, PunctuationType, Punctuator)
    Use ProcessorContext.schedule(Duration, PunctuationType, Punctuator) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.processor.MockProcessorContext.schedule(long, PunctuationType, Punctuator)
    org.apache.kafka.streams.state.WindowBytesStoreSupplier.segments()
    since 2.1. Use WindowBytesStoreSupplier.segmentIntervalMs() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Windows.segments(int)
    since 2.1 Override segmentInterval() instead.
    org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.MockConsumer.setException(KafkaException)
    Use MockConsumer.setPollException(KafkaException) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.UnlimitedWindows.startOn(long)
    Use UnlimitedWindows.startOn(Instant) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.store(String, QueryableStoreType<T>)
    since 2.5 release; use KafkaStreams.store(StoreQueryParameters) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.through(String)
    since 2.6; used KStream.repartition() instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.KStream.through(String, Produced<K, V>)
    since 2.6; use KStream.repartition(Repartitioned) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyDescription.Source.topics()
    use TopologyDescription.Source.topicSet() or TopologyDescription.Source.topicPattern() instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.JoinWindows.until(long)
    since 2.1. Use JoinWindows.grace(Duration) instead.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.Windows.until(long)
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.withRetention(Duration) or directly configure the retention in a store supplier and use Materialized.as(WindowBytesStoreSupplier).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.TimeWindows.until(long)
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention or directly configure the retention in a store supplier and use Materialized.as(WindowBytesStoreSupplier).
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.UnlimitedWindows.until(long)
    since 2.1.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.SessionWindows.until(long)
    since 2.1. Use Materialized.retention or directly configure the retention in a store supplier and use Materialized.as(SessionBytesStoreSupplier).
    org.apache.kafka.common.Metric.value()
    As of 1.0.0, use Metric.metricValue() instead. This will be removed in a future major release.
    org.apache.kafka.streams.kstream.SessionWindows.with(long)
    Use SessionWindows.with(Duration) instead.

    Constructor and Description

    since 1.1.0. This constructor will be removed in a future release.

    use KafkaStreams.KafkaStreams(Topology, Properties, Time) instead
    org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver(Topology, Properties, long)
    Since 2.4 use TopologyTestDriver.TopologyTestDriver(Topology, Properties, Instant)
